li: Provide coding support (primarily in R) to Pharmacokineticists conducting PK, PD, Toxicokinetic, Population PK analyses, etc. related to drug development
li.1: Support clinical pharmacology experts in the design and interpretation of Phase 1 clinical studies in healthy volunteers or special populations (e.g., hepatic and renal impaired, etc.)
li.2: Assist with designing programming code to generate summary PK and PD tables, listings, and graphs from clinical and nonclinical data
li.3: Assist with the development of code to clean and summarize data from nonclinical and clinical studies, including implementation of CDISC (SDTM, ADaM, and SEND) standards
li.4: Develop well commented template code that can be reused across multiple studies and scenarios by multiple programmers
li.5: Work independently to provide complex programming support across the company and for Clients
li.6: Participate in the development of and ensure compliance with standard operating procedures and guidelines
li.7: Manage and lead projects with minimal guidance
